text: The article lists China's province-level divisions by gross domestic product (GDP). Each province's GDP is listed in both the national currency renminbi (CN¥), and at nominal U.S. dollar values according to annual average exchange rates and according to purchasing power parity (PPP). Historical figures and rankings, including purchasing power parity (PPP) figures, are also given for main years since 1978. Figures for Hong Kong and Macau, which are special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China. All the CN¥ figures are from the National Bureau of Statistics of China. Annual PPP rates are taken from the International Monetary Fund's World Economic Outlook (WEO) databases. == Map == This is map of Chinese provinces and SARs by GDP in US Dollars (2021) {| class="wikitable" |- | >$1 trillion $500 billion - $1.0 trillion $200 - $500 billion <$200 billion |} ==2021== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ List of Chinese provinces and SARs by GDP (in billions of US$) GDP-2021 is a preliminary data |- !colspan=7 align=center|preliminary estimation; average rate: CN¥ 6.3527 per U.S. dollar |- align=center !Provinces / SARs!!Rank!!GDP ()!!Nominal GDP (US$)!! prefecture-level cities by GDP ==Notes== This is a list of the first-level administrative divisions of Mainland China (including all provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities) in order of their total gross domestic product. == References == GDP GDP GDP Chinese administrative divisions by GDP Category:Economy of China by province Category:Economy of China-related lists China, GDP
title: List of Chinese administrative divisions by GDP
